Articles.Content:
I figure now is a good time to post the ships of my space program:

Includes 2 Block 7 KSOs (custom named), 2 Block 4 EWBCLs (custom named), SLS Block 1s, and 2 SLS Block 2s.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

OOo. Now we need to devise the multi-texture loading per object in-game feature... I'd love to see these named shuttles side-by-side up in orbit--especially the special edition paint job on the new wide body shuttle!
Very nice, will try tomorrow.

OOo. Now we need to devise the multi-texture loading per object in-game feature... I'd love to see these named shuttles side-by-side up in orbit--especially the special edition paint job on the new wide body shuttle!

You can creat separate parts for each named shuttle to have them exist at the same time. That how I have my 4 shuttles done.
Is anyone else having a problem with the separatrons causing a catastrophic failure to the ship? Its easily fixed by removing 4 of the 8 seperatrons in the craft file version.
A space station I built a while back with KSO, multi-role station class Omega (multi-role since it has one of each habitable module.)

Is anyone else having a problem with the separatrons causing a catastrophic failure to the ship? Its easily fixed by removing 4 of the 8 seperatrons in the craft file version.

Nope, this was never an issue in testing. Even when the sep system wasnt on the craft the LRBs just clunked harmlessly against the wings.

Whats happening exactly?

You can creat separate parts for each named shuttle to have them exist at the same time. That how I have my 4 shuttles done.

Well cool! -- though I wonder with KSP memory management as it is; it's just as efficient to do it that way than devise some elaborate texture picker method.

Well cool! -- though I wonder with KSP memory management as it is; it's just as efficient to do it that way than devise some elaborate texture picker method.

Its probably just as efficient. Even with at texture picker plugin, KSP still loads all the textures.

http://ns1.globalonehosting.com/billfiles/games/ksp/kso/altnames_super25.zip

Here is a copy of what you can install to get the altnames into KSP quickly w/o messing around.

Fantastic work again guys, a must have in my campaign! Even suffering my custom rebuilds and alternating designs the ships still fly like a bird. I mean, some mistakes were made in the cockpit, but those were... uh... slight snack related errors. There was no fighting over a slushy...

Where there some Apollo 13 inspiration in that vid, Naz?

Where there some Apollo 13 inspiration in that vid, Naz?

Hmm, haven't seen the film in years, why?
The part with the Kerbal and the car very much resembles the scene int he film where Ken Mattingly is watching 13 lift off without him...

Craft file: KSO EWBCL Block 4 (Energia)

I must stress that this is a non-standard Super 25 launch configuration, and as such will not be supported by the KSO team.

Yes! it's released!!!

Great work guys!
its here its here, YES thank you!
Congratulations on the release everyone!
Yayyy its released! BUT: The KSO 25 Video isn't avaible in Germany, **** GEMA!

I completely blame Nazari for this... this wonderful feat of engineering:

http://imgur.com/a/2vl5h

Craft file: KSO EWBCL Block 4 (Energia)

I must stress that this is a non-standard Super 25 launch configuration, and as such will not be supported by the KSO team.

Nice, did you get the SRB seperation fixed? Or do they still blow up

Nice, did you get the SRB seperation fixed? Or do they still blow up

After tweaking it some, I got them to separate cleanly at a 45 degree pitch. The tweaks I made are represented in that craft file. But I cant promise it'll be flawless it only under went one test flight with the tweaks.

After tweaking it some, I got them to separate cleanly at a 45 degree pitch. The tweaks I made are represented in that craft file. But I cant promise it'll be flawless it only under went one test flight with the tweaks.

When I unlock it in the tech tree I'll give it a test flight, it looks really great with that energia lift stage. Also it might come in handy for those very heavy payloads if you can fit them in the cargo bay.

with the dawn of the super 25 the standard KSO has become a historic piece at KSC even jeb had to take a look.
